choices.D: vSphere Replication supports virtual machines with snapshots.
choices.A: vSphere Replication retains a number of snapshot instances of the virtual machine on the target site based on the retention policy that you specify.
choices.C: vSphere Replication does not support virtual machines with snapshots.
choices.B: vSphere Replication uses the virtual machine's snapshot instances to define the target site Point in Time instance based on the retention policy that you specify.

questions.question_text:
An administrator configures vSphere Replication for a virtual machine and enables multiple point in time (PIT) instances under the recovery settings in the
Configure Replication wizard.
Which two statements are correct for vSphere Replication with multiple point in time instances enabled? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Web services over the Management Network
choices.B: VMkernel services (such as NFS, iSCSI, or vMotion) to the physical network

questions.question_text: Which two networking connection types can be configured on a virtual switch? (Choose two.)
Which three conditions would prevent Storage I/O Control from being enabled on a group of datastores? (Choose three.)

choices.D: A datastore planned for the solution is configured as NFS.
choices.B: A datastore planned for the solution is configured as a Raw Device Mapping file.
choices.C: A datastore planned for the solution has three extents.
choices.A: The datastores planned for the solution are used by different vSphere clusters.
choices.E: The organization has an Enterprise license.

questions.question_text: What is the default load balancing policy for a newly created VMkernel port on a vSphere Distributed Switch?

choices.A: Route based on originating virtual port ID
choices.D: Route based on physical NIC load
choices.C: Route based on source mac address

choices.B: Create at least one vSphere Standard Switch.
choices.E: Place the host into maintenance mode with Full Migration option selected.
choices.D: Remove the host from vSAN cluster.
choices.C: Remove VMKernel port with vSAN traffic checkbox checked.
choices.A: Remove disks from diskgroups, remove disk groups.

questions.question_text: What three steps must be taken when removing a host from a vSAN-enabled cluster? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: The answer is A, D y E
